messages.original: Kinzhal on Sumy Oblast, flying to chernihiv
Kinzhal on Sumy Oblast, flying to chernihiv
Flew past Krolevets on a southwestern course to Kyiv.
Entering Kyiv Oblast, flying towards Fastiv.
Entering Kyiv Oblast, flying towards Fastiv.
Correction: flying towards Vyshhorod/Hostomel, Kyiv Oblast.
Explosion in Makariv, Kyiv Oblast.

Power surges in Dnipro
Power and water outages in Zaporizhzhia City
Power outages in Kherson too
Meanwhile on twitter
Meanwhile on twitter

Yes, Ukraine has actually lost all of their radars and relies on foreign telegram channels to intercept missiles 
üòÅ

Here is the current missile map, which I adjusted slightly from my earlier reports due to information I have clarified. 
So far, 12 Iskander-M ballistic missiles and 4 Kinzhals have been used:
5 Iskanders on Zelenodolsk, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast
3 Iskanders on Vyshhorod, Kyiv Oblast
3 Iskanders on Dnipro
1 Iskanders on Pivdenne, Odesa Oblast
3 Kinzhals on southwestern Khmelnytskyi Oblast
1 Kinzhal on Makariv, Kyiv Oblast
1 Iskander-M flying to Kyiv was shot down over the Kyiv Reservoir.

According to updated information, a total of 9 (!) Tu-95MS strategic bombers are airborne and are either circling near the launch lines or flying to them.
3 Tu-160s are also flying to the launch lines.
This means that a MAXIMUM of 108 Kh-101 cruise missiles can be used (the actual number of launches will be smaller).
This will likely be the largest missile attack of 2025.

Mass launches of Geran-2 drones have begun again.
This will be the main wave that attacks alongside Kh-101 cruise missiles.

Remember, there is still 1 "Varshavyanka" Submarine at sea, just outside Novorossiysk Bay. It can launch a total of 6 Kalibr cruise missiles.
Reports of an "Admiral Makarov" Frigate and a second submarine exiting Novorossiysk Naval Base are false, however they can still launch up to 14 additional Kalibrs from within the naval base.
3 Tu-160s and 5 Tu-95MS from Ukrainka and Belaya Airbases in the far east are 2-2.5 hours away from the first set of launch lines over the village of Uzmore, Saratov Oblast.

Forgot to report this earlier:
The Geran strikes on Fastiv, Kyiv Oblast, targeted the city's railway station.

Forgot to report this earlier:
The Geran strikes on Fastiv, Kyiv Oblast, targeted the city's railway station.
The 5 Tu-95MS and 3 Tu-160s are about 1 hour, 40 minutes from their launch lines in Engels District, Saratov Oblast.
The 5 Tu-95MS and 3 Tu-160s are about 1 hour, 40 minutes from their launch lines in Engels District, Saratov Oblast.
Remember, there are another 4 Tu-95MS circling in Saratov Oblast right now, waiting for the bombers from the far east. They are the ones which took off from Engels-2 Airbase.
Its likely that at least a significant portion of the Kh-101s will indeed target the western regions of Ukraine.

Currently, there are only ~45 Geran-2 drones detected in Ukrainian airspace. 
However, a lot more will begin flying in shortly, to take part in strikes with the Kh-101 missiles.

Iranian Drones Tracked U.S. Warship During Live-Fire Drills (Video)
Iran‚Äôs Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) Navy on December 4 kicked off a two-day naval exercise, issuing warnings to United States warships operating in waters near the Islamic Republic.
The exercise is named after Mohammad Nazeri, a commander of the elite commando units of the IRGC Navy who lost his life in 2016. It is taking place in the Persian Gulf, the Hormuz Strait, the Sea of Oman, and the islands of Abu Musa, Greater Tunb, Lesser Tunb, and Siri.
Iranian state TV reported the exercise showcases the ‚Äúsacrifice and spirit of resistance‚Äù of the IRGC‚Äôs naval forces ‚Äúto confront any threat‚Äù against Iran following the 12-day war with Israel last June.

U.S. Hits Another Alleged Drug Boat As Trump Renews Threats Of Land Strikes On Venezuela (Video)
The United States military on December 4 conducted another deadly strike on an alleged drug smuggling boat in the Eastern Pacific Ocean, killing four.
In a statement, the U.S Southern Command (SOUTHCOM) said that the strike was carried out by the Joint Task Force Southern Spear at the direction of Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth.
‚ÄúIntelligence confirmed that the vessel was carrying illicit narcotics and transiting along a known narco-trafficking route in the Eastern Pacific. Four male narco-terrorists aboard the vessel were killed,‚Äù the command added.
This was the 22nd alleged drug boat to be hit by SOUTHCOM since the U.S. military began its campaign against drug cartels in the Eastern Pacific and the Caribbean Sea last September. Including the last casualties, the campaign has so far claimed the lives of at least 83 people, all alleged drug traffickers.
üëâ

Europe‚Äôs Arms Makers: The Key Beneficiaries of War, the Blockers of Peace
On December 2, Russian President Vladimir Putin outlined whom he considers responsible for obstructing a peaceful resolution to the war in Ukraine. According to him, despite what he described as clear interest from both Moscow and Washington in ending the conflict, the European Union has repeatedly derailed potential agreements.
‚ÄúEven when they try to amend Trump‚Äôs proposals, it is obvious that all these changes are aimed at one thing: blocking the entire peace process,‚Äù he said.
Brussels‚Äô assessment of the situation has also drawn criticism. EU foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas stated that Russia must reduce its military budget and limit the size of its armed forces‚Äîeffectively demanding the ‚Äúdemilitarization‚Äù of Moscow as the principal geopolitical rival. Given the realities on the front line, such expectations appear unrealistic. Yet these statements are not merely rhetorical.

Russian Strikes Soften Ukrainian Defenses In Huliaipole Ahead Of Large Assault (Videos)
The Russian military has intensified strikes on the key city of Huliaipole and its outskirts in Zaporozhye likely in preparation of a large-scale assault, videos from December 5 and previous days show.
In the last few days, the Vostok [East] Group of Forces, which leads operations in this direction, captured the last two settlements to the east of Huliaipole, Zelenyi Hai and Vysoke, from Kiev forces.
The group also broke through Ukrainian defenses along the Haichur River to the north of the city, capturing Dobropillya and storming Varvarivka. Fierce fighting is currently taking place in the latter, with preliminary reports indicating that at least the northern part of the large settlement has been already secured.
üëâ

When Morale Breaks: Inside Ukraine‚Äôs Failing War Machine
The Russian army‚Äôs strategy is gradually bearing fruit. The Ukrainian army‚Äôs tactical crises are turning into operational ones. Four years of intense conflict are taking their toll on Ukrainian troops. They are becoming less and less motivated to fight.
High-intensity armed conflicts cannot last for decades. The examples of World Wars I and II confirm this, as one of the warring parties suffered defeat due to the depletion of necessary resources. For countries waging wars of this type, having vital reserves is critically important. This was one of the key reasons for Germany‚Äôs defeat.
Russia and Ukraine‚Äôs military capabilities are not comparable in scale. Even disregarding nuclear weapons, Kyiv‚Äôs conventional forces are significantly inferior to Moscow‚Äôs. However, besides troops, dozens of factors determine the success of a war. 
üëâ

Russian Army Broke Through Key Ukrainian Defense Line In Siversk
On December 5, the Russian military‚Äôs Yug [South] Group of Forces broke through a key Ukrainian defense line within the city of the Siversk in Donetsk.
The line, which includes strong fortifications, lies along the eastern part of Siversk. After breaking through the line, Russian troops managed to expand their control in the eastern part of the city, even reaching the multi-story residential area on Energetikov Street which oversees all nearby areas.
Following the breakthrough, some Ukrainian news sources began to sound the alarm over the catastrophic situation in Siversk.
Ukrainian troops held up in the city lost their last main supply route a few days earlier when the Yug Group of Forces stormed Sviato-Pokrovske to the south and cut the T-05-13 road. The city is not besieged yet, but bringing in supplies is getting harder by the day.
üëâ

U.S. Strategy Shift and Russian-Ukrainian Strikes on December 4-5 (Videos) 
On December 4-5, Russian and Ukrainian forces continued to exchange strikes. According to the Russian Defense Ministry, during the night of December 5, Russian air defense systems intercepted and destroyed 41 Ukrainian unmanned aerial vehicles over several regions. A statement from the Ukrainian Air Force reported that on the same night, Russia employed 137 attack UAVs, of which 80 were shot down or suppressed by Ukrainian air defense and electronic warfare assets.
These developments unfolded against the backdrop of the published update to the U.S. National Security Strategy, wherein Washington's foreign policy priorities were revised. According to the document, the U.S. administration considers achieving a swift end to the conflict in Ukraine to be a vital interest, aimed at stabilizing the European economy, preventing escalation, and restoring strategic stability in relations with Russia. 
üëâ

From Myrnohrad To Rodinskoye: Russia Develops Offensive On Ukraine‚Äôs Northern Flank
Russian units have advanced to Donetska Street in the northeastern outskirts of Huliaipole and approached the Haichur River. The Ukrainian grouping in Siversk is practically paralyzed due to the loss of control over the main logistical routes to the north and south of the city. 
The U.S. administration is lobbying against the EU's plans to provide Kyiv with a substantial loan for 2026‚Äì2027.
